analyzed: theḥ apadāna  a vaṭa phala vagga
translated: Elder Story🔽The Chapter with Avaṭa and Phala
The Elder Avaṭaphaladāyaka’s Story
“The Fortunate One named Sataraṁsi,
self-dependent, unconquered,
the Sambuddha, desiring solitude,
went out for alms.
Seeing him, with a fruit in my hand,🔽I approached the Lord of Men;
With a confident mind, full of joy,
I gave him a fruit.
For ninety-four aeons,
the fruit that I gave,
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of giving a fruit.
My defilements have been burnt up,
all my existences have been destroyed;
Like an elephant who has broken his bonds,
I live without pollutants.
How welcome it was for me
in the presence of the Buddha;
The three knowledges have been attained,
and the Buddha’s instruction has been done.
The four analytical insights,
and the eight liberations,
the six super-knowledges have been experienced,
and the Buddha’s instruction has been done.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā avaṭaphaladāyako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmai avaṭaphaladāyakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: Thus the venerable Elder Avaṭaphaladāyaka recited these verses.
The Story of the Elder Avaṭaphaladāyaka is finished.
